body
format:
<template>
    <v-container>
      <v-row>
        <!-- First Row: Larger cards with icon centered above title -->
        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="preview"
            class="text-center py-2"
            variant="flat"
          >
            <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-eye</v-icon>
            <v-card-title class="text-h6">Launch the Preview</v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Access a real-time, high-resolution preview to inspect the contents of your current water sample.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="metadata"
            class="text-center py-2"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-play-circle</v-icon>
            <v-card-title class="text-h6">Start Acquisition</v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Start a new acquisition process to continuously collect images and metadata from your PlanktoScope.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="visualization"
            target="_blank"
            class="text-center py-2"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-icon size="64" color="primary">mdi-database-search</v-icon>
            <v-card-title class="text-h6">Explore Your Data</v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Open the data explorer to review, categorize, and interpret all previously captured sample information.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>

      <!-- Second Row: Standard size cards -->
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="/ps/docs/operation/protocol-v4.pdf"
            target="_blank"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-book-open-variant</v-icon>
              Learn the Basics
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Find detailed instructions on using your PlanktoScope.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="http://pkscope-rich-kettle-10463.local/admin/grafana/d/host-summary/host-summary?orgId=1&from=now-5m&to=now&timezone=browser&var-DS_PROMETHEUS=PBFA97CFB590B2093&var-job=node-exporter&var-node=host.docker.internal:9100&var-diskdevices=%5Ba-z%5D%2B%7Cnvme%5B0-9%5D%2Bn%5B0-9%5D%2B%7Cmmcblk%5B0-9%5D%2B&refresh=5s"
            target="_blank"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-speedometer</v-icon>
              Monitoring
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Keep track of system status and performance metrics.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="4">
          <v-card
            href="calibration"
            variant="outlined"
          >
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-tune</v-icon>
              Calibration
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>Adjust and verify settings for consistent results.</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>

      <!-- Third Row: Standard size cards -->
      <v-row>
        <v-col :cols="12" :md="msg.payload.machine_info.serial_number ? 3 : 4">
          <v-card variant="tonal">
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-cube-outline</v-icon>
              Model of your machine
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>{{ msg.payload.machine_info.hardware_version }}</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col cols="12" md="3" v-if="msg.payload.machine_info.serial_number">
          <v-card variant="tonal">
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-barcode-scan</v-icon>
              Serial number
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>{{ msg.payload.machine_info.serial_number }}</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col :cols="12" :md="msg.payload.machine_info.serial_number ? 3 : 4">
          <v-card variant="tonal">
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-label-outline</v-icon>
              Name of your machine
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>{{ msg.payload.machine_info.machine_name }}</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>

        <v-col :cols="12" :md="msg.payload.machine_info.serial_number ? 3 : 4">
          <v-card variant="tonal">
            <v-card-title>
              <v-icon class="mr-2" color="primary">mdi-code-tags</v-icon>
              Software version
            </v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>{{ msg.payload.machine_info.software_version }}</v-card-text>
          </v-card>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>

    </v-container>
</template>

name: Sample Information
Starting point
Ending point
Net Specificity
format:
<template>
  <!-- Conteneur principal dsactiv si sample_gear n'est ni Horizontal Net ni Vertical Net -->
    <v-container
      fluid
      class="pa-2"
      :disabled="isDisabled"
      :style="{
        pointerEvents: isDisabled ? 'none' : 'auto',
        opacity: isDisabled ? 0.5 : 1,
        width: '100%',
      }"
    >

    <v-row class="mt-2">
      <!-- Net Mouth Diameter -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Mouth Opening Diameter"
          v-model.number="sample_net_mouth_diameter"
          :min="0"
          :max="1000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="cm"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details="auto"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_net_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('mouth_diameter')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-text-field>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Net Length -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Length of the Net"
          v-model.number="sample_net_length"
          :min="0"
          :max="1000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="cm"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details="auto"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_net_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('net_length')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-text-field>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Mesh Size -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Net Mesh Size"
          v-model.number="sample_net_mesh_size"
          :min="0"
          :max="1000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="m"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details="auto"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_net_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('mesh_size')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-text-field>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Collector Volume -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Volume of the Collector"
          v-model.number="sample_collected_volume"
          :min="0"
          :max="1000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="mL"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details="auto"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_net_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('collector_volume')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-text-field>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- MID-INFO POPUP -->
    <v-dialog v-model="hintDialog" max-width="500">
      <v-card>
        <v-card-title class="text-h6">{{ hintTitle }}</v-card-title>
        <v-card-text>{{ hintText }}</v-card-text>
        <v-card-actions>
          <v-spacer></v-spacer>
          <v-btn color="primary" text @click="hintDialog = false">Got it</v-btn>
        </v-card-actions>
      </v-card>
    </v-dialog>
  </v-container>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  props: ["msg"],
  data() {
    return {
      sample_net_mouth_diameter: "",
      sample_net_length: "",
      sample_net_mesh_size: "",
      sample_collected_volume: "",
      sample_gear: "",
      hintDialog: false,
      hintTitle: "",
      hintText: "",
    };
  },
  computed: {
    isTablet() {
      return this.$vuetify.display.mdAndDown;
    },
    isDisabled() {
      // Dsactiver si sample_gear n'est pas "Horizontal Net" ou "Vertical Net"
      return !["Horizontal Net", "Vertical Net"].includes(this.sample_gear);
    },
  },
  watch: {
    msg: {
      handler(newMsg) {
        const p = newMsg?.payload || {};
        if (p.sample_gear !== undefined) this.sample_gear = p.sample_gear; // <-- rcupre la valeur reue
        if (p.sample_net_mouth_diameter !== undefined)
          this.sample_net_mouth_diameter = Number(p.sample_net_mouth_diameter);
        if (p.sample_net_length !== undefined)
          this.sample_net_length = Number(p.sample_net_length);
        if (p.sample_net_mesh_size !== undefined)
          this.sample_net_mesh_size = Number(p.sample_net_mesh_size);
        if (p.sample_collected_volume !== undefined)
          this.sample_collected_volume = Number(p.sample_collected_volume);
      },
      deep: true,
    },
  },
  methods: {
    /**
     * Send updates (ensures all values are numbers)
     */
    sendUpdate(topic, extra = {}) {
      this.send({
        topic,
        payload: {
          sample_net_mouth_diameter: Number(this.sample_net_mouth_diameter) || 0,
          sample_net_length: Number(this.sample_net_length) || 0,
          sample_net_mesh_size: Number(this.sample_net_mesh_size) || 0,
          sample_collected_volume: Number(this.sample_collected_volume) || 0,
          ...extra,
        },
      });
    },

    /**
     * Info popup  consistent with previous templates
     */
    openHint(type) {
      if (type === "mouth_diameter") {
        this.hintTitle = "Mouth Opening Diameter";
        this.hintText =
          "Enter the diameter of the nets mouth  the circular opening where water enters the net  measured in centimeters (cm). " +
          "Typical plankton nets range from 2060 cm in diameter. Larger diameters capture more water volume.";
      } else if (type === "net_length") {
        this.hintTitle = "Length of the Net";
        this.hintText =
          "Specify the total length of the net from the mouth opening to the collector. " +
          "Measure in centimeters (cm). This helps calculate the water volume filtered and affects flow resistance.";
      } else if (type === "mesh_size") {
        this.hintTitle = "Net Mesh Size";
        this.hintText =
          "Enter the mesh size of the net in micrometers (m). " +
          "This defines the smallest particles or plankton that can pass through. For example, a 20 m mesh captures microplankton but not bacteria.";
      } else if (type === "collector_volume") {
        this.hintTitle = "Volume of the Collector";
        this.hintText =
          "Specify the amount of sample collected after towing or pumping, measured in milliliters (mL). " +
          "It should correspond to the water filtered and ensures proper concentration calculations.";
      }
      this.hintDialog = true;
    },
  },
};
</script>

<style scoped>
@media (max-width: 1024px) {
  .v-text-field input,
  .v-select input {
    font-size: 1.2rem !important;
  }
}
</style>

name: Other Informations
format:
<template>
  <v-container fluid class="pa-2">
    <v-row class="mt-2">
      <!-- Filtered Volume -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Filtered Volume"
          v-model.number="sample_filtered_volume"
          :min="0"
          :max="100000"
          :step="1"
          suffix="L"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details="auto"
          :disabled="isDisabled"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_water_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('filtered_volume')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-text-field>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Concentration Factor -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Concentration Factor"
          v-model.number="sample_concentration_factor"
          :min="0"
          :max="100"
          :step="0.01"
          suffix=""
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details="auto"
          :disabled="isDisabled"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_water_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('concentration_factor')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-text-field>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Sieve Mesh Size -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Sieve Mesh Size"
          v-model.number="sample_sieve_mesh_size"
          :min="1"
          :max="1000"
          :step="10"
          suffix="m"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details="auto"
          :disabled="isDisabled"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_water_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('sieve_mesh_size')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-text-field>
      </v-col>

      <!-- Sample Depth -->
      <v-col cols="12" md="3">
        <v-text-field
          label="Depth of the Sample"
          v-model.number="sample_depth"
          :min="0"
          :max="10935"
          :step="1"
          suffix="m"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details="auto"
          :disabled="isDisabled"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_water_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('sample_depth')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-text-field>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- Sample Comment (Toujours actif) -->
    <v-row>
      <v-col cols="12">
        <v-textarea
          label="Sample Comment"
          v-model="sample_comment"
          variant="outlined"
          rows="2"
          :density="isTablet ? 'comfortable' : 'default'"
          @input="sendUpdate('sample_water_params')"
        >
          <template #append>
            <v-icon class="cursor-pointer" @click="openHint('sample_comment')">
              mdi-information
            </v-icon>
          </template>
        </v-textarea>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>

    <!-- MID-INFO POPUP -->
    <v-dialog v-model="hintDialog" max-width="500">
      <v-card>
        <v-card-title class="text-h6">{{ hintTitle }}</v-card-title>
        <v-card-text>{{ hintText }}</v-card-text>
        <v-card-actions>
          <v-spacer></v-spacer>
          <v-btn color="primary" text @click="hintDialog = false">Got it</v-btn>
        </v-card-actions>
      </v-card>
    </v-dialog>
  </v-container>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  props: ["msg"],
  data() {
    return {
      sample_filtered_volume: "",
      sample_concentration_factor: "",
      sample_sieve_mesh_size: "",
      sample_depth: "",
      sample_comment: "",
      sample_gear: "", // <-- ajout
      hintDialog: false,
      hintTitle: "",
      hintText: "",
    };
  },
  computed: {
    isTablet() {
      return this.$vuetify.display.mdAndDown;
    },
    //  Disable fields if Lab culture or Demo / Test
    isDisabled() {
      return ["Lab culture", "Demo / Test"].includes(this.sample_gear);
    },
  },
  watch: {
    msg: {
      handler(newMsg) {
        const p = newMsg?.payload || {};
        if (p.sample_gear !== undefined) this.sample_gear = p.sample_gear;
        if (p.sample_filtered_volume !== undefined)
          this.sample_filtered_volume = Number(p.sample_filtered_volume);
        if (p.sample_concentration_factor !== undefined)
          this.sample_concentration_factor = Number(p.sample_concentration_factor);
        if (p.sample_sieve_mesh_size !== undefined)
          this.sample_sieve_mesh_size = Number(p.sample_sieve_mesh_size);
        if (p.sample_depth !== undefined)
          this.sample_depth = Number(p.sample_depth);
        if (p.sample_comment !== undefined)
          this.sample_comment = String(p.sample_comment);
      },
      deep: true,
    },
  },
  methods: {
    sendUpdate(topic, extra = {}) {
      this.send({
        topic,
        payload: {
          sample_filtered_volume: Number(this.sample_filtered_volume) || 0,
          sample_concentration_factor: Number(this.sample_concentration_factor) || 0,
          sample_sieve_mesh_size: Number(this.sample_sieve_mesh_size) || 0,
          sample_depth: Number(this.sample_depth) || 0,
          sample_comment: this.sample_comment || "",
          ...extra,
        },
      });
    },

    openHint(type) {
      if (type === "filtered_volume") {
        this.hintTitle = "Filtered Volume";
        this.hintText =
          "Enter the total volume of water that passed through the net or filter during sampling, measured in liters (L).";
      } else if (type === "concentration_factor") {
        this.hintTitle = "Concentration Factor";
        this.hintText =
          "Specify the ratio by which the filtered water volume was concentrated into the final collected sample.";
      } else if (type === "sieve_mesh_size") {
        this.hintTitle = "Sieve Mesh Size";
        this.hintText =
          "Indicate the mesh size of the sieve used to separate particles or organisms, in micrometers (m).";
      } else if (type === "sample_depth") {
        this.hintTitle = "Depth of the Sample";
        this.hintText =
          "Specify the depth (in meters) at which the sample was collected.";
      } else if (type === "sample_comment") {
        this.hintTitle = "Sample Comment";
        this.hintText =
          "Add any notes or context about the sample (e.g., weather, color, debris, issues).";
      }
      this.hintDialog = true;
    },
  },
};
</script>

<style scoped>
@media (max-width: 1024px) {
  .v-text-field input,
  .v-textarea textarea {
    font-size: 1.2rem !important;
  }
}
</style>

name: Count objects segmented
convert px to um
Histogram of equivalent_diameter
content:
### Distribution of Object Sizes  
Understanding the size distribution of planktonic objects helps identify dominant size classes and detect anomalies. A skewed distribution might indicate specific biological trends, such as a bloom of a particular species or a technical issue in the acquisition process.  

*In the graph:*  
- A **peak in smaller sizes** suggests dominance of tiny plankton.  
- A **broad distribution** indicates a mix of various size classes.  
- A **skewed or bimodal pattern** may reflect biological or technical factors (e.g., species-specific blooms or imaging biases).

name: elongation vs. area
content:
### Relationship Between Elongation and Object Area  
This scatter plot helps assess whether larger objects tend to be more elongated or compact. Certain plankton species have characteristic shapes, and identifying correlations between elongation and area can aid in distinguishing different taxa or understanding morphological variability.  

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Large and highly elongated objects (e.g., filamentous plankton).  
- **Bottom-right**: Small but highly elongated objects (e.g., thin needle-like forms). 
- **Top-left**: Large but compact objects (e.g., rounded or clustered plankton). 
- **Bottom-left**: Small and compact objects (e.g., spherical or short structures).

name: elongation vs. area
label: elongation vs. area
xAxisLabel: elongation (ratio of major to minor axis)

name: equivalent_diameter vs. MeanValue
content:
### Variation of Mean Brightness with Equivalent Diameter  
This graph explores whether larger objects tend to be brighter or darker. This can reveal differences in pigmentation, transparency, or even imaging inconsistencies.  

*In the graph:*   
- **Top-right**: Large and bright objects.
- **Top-left**: Small and bright objects.
- **Bottom-right**: Large and dark objects.
- **Bottom-left**: Small and dark objects.

name: MeanSaturation vs. MeanValue
content:
### Relationship Between Mean Saturation and Mean Brightness
This visualization helps understand how color properties vary with brightness. Some plankton groups exhibit distinct coloration, and saturation could be a useful feature for classification. A strong trend might suggest systematic differences in pigmentation or optical properties across plankton groups.

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Bright and highly saturated objects (vivid colors).  
- **Top-left**: Bright but low-saturation objects (pale or near-white).  
- **Bottom-right**: Dark but highly saturated objects (deep, rich colors).  
- **Bottom-left**: Dark and low-saturation objects (grayish or faintly colored).

name: Sliders
format:
<template>
  <v-card class="ma-20 pa-2">
    <v-row class="ma-20 pa-2">
      <v-col cols="12" sm="10">
        <v-slider
          v-model="slider"
          :max="max"
          :min="min"
          :step="0.2"
          class="align-center"
          hide-details
          label="Label"
          :thumb-size="30"
        />
      </v-col>
      <v-col cols="12" sm="2">
        <v-text-field
          v-model="slider"
          prepend-inner-icon="mdi-information-outline"
          type="number"
          variant="outlined"
          hide-details
          suffix="suffix"
          density="compact"
          @click:prepend-inner="showDialog = true"
        />
        <v-dialog v-model="showDialog" max-width="500px">
          <v-card>
            <v-card-title>Information</v-card-title>
            <v-card-text>
              This is some additional information displayed in a dialog.
            </v-card-text>
            <v-card-actions>
              <v-btn text @click="showDialog = false">Close</v-btn>
            </v-card-actions>
          </v-card>
        </v-dialog>
      </v-col>
    </v-row>
  </v-card>
</template>

<script>
  export default {
    data() {
      return {
        showDialog: false, // Controls dialog visibility
        min: -50,
        max: 90,
        slider: 40,
      }
    },
  }
</script>

name: Vuetify links
content:
# Vuetify Resources and Examples

This document provides useful links and references for working with Vuetify components, icons, and examples.

## Vuetify Documentation
- **Component Usage**: Learn how to use components in Vuetify.  
  [View Documentation](https://vuetifyjs.com/en/components/all/#containment)

- **API Reference**: Explore the full API details for `v-field`.  
  [View API](https://vuetifyjs.com/en/api/v-field/)

## Icons
- **Material Design Icons**: Access the Material Design Icons (MDI) library for Vuetify projects.  
  [Explore Icons](https://pictogrammers.github.io/@mdi/font/2.0.46/)

## Code Playground
- **Vue Play**: Experiment with Vue.js and Vuetify components in an interactive playground.  
  [Open Playground](https://play.vuetifyjs.com/#)

name: Illustration of the Flow
content:
## Illustration of the Flow

### **1. UI Event**
**Node Name**: `UI Event`  
**Description**: Captures user events from the dashboard (e.g., page navigation).  
**Connected Dashboard**: `My Dashboard`.

```javascript
// Emits messages with the topic and page path when an event occurs.
```

---

### **2. Switch: `$pageview`**
**Node Name**: `msg.topic === "$pageview"`  
**Description**: Filters messages where `msg.topic` equals `$pageview`, ensuring only page navigation events are processed.

**Rule**:
```javascript
msg.topic === "$pageview";
```

---

### **3. Switch: `/load`**
**Node Name**: `msg.payload.page.path === "/load"`  
**Description**: Filters messages to pass only those where the page path matches `/load`.

**Rule**:
```javascript
msg.payload.page.path === "/load";
```

---

### **4. Debug**
**Node Name**: `msg.payload.page.path`  
**Description**: Outputs the value of `msg.payload.page.path` to the debug sidebar in Node-RED for monitoring purposes.

```javascript
// Outputs:
// msg.payload.page.path
```

---

## Supporting Details

- **Dashboard Base**: `My Dashboard`  
  - Accessible at `/dashboard`.  
  - Includes navigation and notification configurations for seamless user interaction.

---

format:
<template>
  <v-text-field
    v-model="variable"
    label="My variable"
    variant="outlined"
    hide-details="auto"
    @input="sendUpdate"
  />
</template>

<script>
export default {
  props: ['msg'],
  data() {
    return {
      variable: this.msg?.payload?.variable ?? ''
    }
  },
  watch: {
    // when a new message comes in with a variable, update the field
    msg: {
      handler(newMsg) {
        if (newMsg?.payload?.variable !== undefined) {
          this.variable = newMsg.payload.variable
        }
      },
      deep: true
    }
  },
  methods: {
    sendUpdate() {
      this.send({
        topic: 'variable',
        payload: this.variable
      })
    }
  }
}
</script>

name: Count objects segmented
Stream Pi Camera
Actions Clock
convert px to um
Histogram of equivalent_diameter
content:
### Distribution of Object Sizes  
Understanding the size distribution of planktonic objects helps identify dominant size classes and detect anomalies. A skewed distribution might indicate specific biological trends, such as a bloom of a particular species or a technical issue in the acquisition process.  

*In the graph:*  
- A **peak in smaller sizes** suggests dominance of tiny plankton.  
- A **broad distribution** indicates a mix of various size classes.  
- A **skewed or bimodal pattern** may reflect biological or technical factors (e.g., species-specific blooms or imaging biases).

name: elongation vs. area
content:
### Relationship Between Elongation and Object Area  
This scatter plot helps assess whether larger objects tend to be more elongated or compact. Certain plankton species have characteristic shapes, and identifying correlations between elongation and area can aid in distinguishing different taxa or understanding morphological variability.  

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Large and highly elongated objects (e.g., filamentous plankton).  
- **Bottom-right**: Small but highly elongated objects (e.g., thin needle-like forms). 
- **Top-left**: Large but compact objects (e.g., rounded or clustered plankton). 
- **Bottom-left**: Small and compact objects (e.g., spherical or short structures).

name: elongation vs. area
label: elongation vs. area
xAxisLabel: elongation (ratio of major to minor axis)

name: equivalent_diameter vs. MeanValue
content:
### Variation of Mean Brightness with Equivalent Diameter  
This graph explores whether larger objects tend to be brighter or darker. This can reveal differences in pigmentation, transparency, or even imaging inconsistencies.  

*In the graph:*   
- **Top-right**: Large and bright objects.
- **Top-left**: Small and bright objects.
- **Bottom-right**: Large and dark objects.
- **Bottom-left**: Small and dark objects.

name: MeanSaturation vs. MeanValue
content:
### Relationship Between Mean Saturation and Mean Brightness
This visualization helps understand how color properties vary with brightness. Some plankton groups exhibit distinct coloration, and saturation could be a useful feature for classification. A strong trend might suggest systematic differences in pigmentation or optical properties across plankton groups.

*In the graph:*  
- **Top-right**: Bright and highly saturated objects (vivid colors).  
- **Top-left**: Bright but low-saturation objects (pale or near-white).  
- **Bottom-right**: Dark but highly saturated objects (deep, rich colors).  
- **Bottom-left**: Dark and low-saturation objects (grayish or faintly colored).

name: 2. Measure the Current Saturation Level
3. Display White Balance Settings
format:
<template>
  <v-card title="3. Observe the current White Balance Settings">
    <v-card-text>
      <canvas id="wbChart"></canvas>
    </v-card-text>
  </v-card>
</template>



<script>
export default {
  data() {
    return {
      chart: null,
    };
  },
  mounted() {
    this.$nextTick(() => {
      this.createChart(); // Initialize the chart after the component is fully mounted
    });
  },
  beforeDestroy() {
    if (this.chart) {
      this.chart.destroy(); // Clean up the chart if the component is destroyed
    }
  },
  methods: {
    createChart(hexColor = '#000000') {
      const canvas = document.getElementById('wbChart');
      if (!canvas) {
        console.error("Canvas element not found.");
        return;
      }

      const ctx = canvas.getContext('2d');
      if (!ctx) {
        console.error("Unable to get canvas context.");
        return;
      }

      const ratios = this.calculateRatiosFromHex(hexColor);

      if (this.chart) {
        this.chart.destroy(); // Ensure any existing chart is destroyed before creating a new one
      }

      this.chart = new Chart(ctx, {
        type: 'scatter',
        data: {
          datasets: [
            {
              label: 'Current WB',
              data: [{ x: ratios.bgRatio, y: ratios.rgRatio }],
              backgroundColor: 'blue',
              borderColor: 'black',
              borderWidth: 1,
              pointRadius: 10,
              pointHoverRadius: 15,
            },
            {
              label: 'Acceptable WB',
              data: [{ x: 1, y: 1 }],
              backgroundColor: '#5cd65c',
              borderColor: 'black',
              borderWidth: 1,
              pointRadius: 50,
              pointHoverRadius: 55,
              pointStyle: 'circle',
              fill: true,
              showLine: false,
            },
          ],
        },
        options: {
          responsive: true,
          maintainAspectRatio: true,
          scales: {
            x: {
              type: 'linear',
              position: 'bottom',
              title: {
                display: true,
                text: 'B/G Ratio',
              },
              min: 0.8,
              max: 1.2,
            },
            y: {
              type: 'linear',
              title: {
                display: true,
                text: 'R/G Ratio',
              },
              min: 0.8,
              max: 1.2,
            },
          },
          plugins: {
            legend: {
              display: true,
            },
          },
          animation: {
            duration: 0, // Disabling animations might prevent some update issues
          },
        },
      });
    },
    calculateRatiosFromHex(hex) {
      const r = parseInt(hex.slice(1, 3), 16);
      const g = parseInt(hex.slice(3, 5), 16);
      const b = parseInt(hex.slice(5, 7), 16);

      const rgRatio = r / g || 0;
      const bgRatio = b / g || 0;

      return { rgRatio, bgRatio };
    },
  },
  watch: {
    msg(newMsg) {
      if (newMsg && newMsg.acq_wb_hex) {
        this.createChart(newMsg.acq_wb_hex);
      }
    },
  },
};
</script>

<style scoped>
#wbChart {
  width: 100% !important;
  height: 400px !important;
}
</style>

name: 4. Adjust White Balance Settings
format:
<template>
  <v-card title="4. Adjust White Balance Settings">
    <v-card-text>
      Use the suggested values to adjust the white balance based on the color input.
    </v-card-text>
    <v-card-text>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4"></v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">Current</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">Suggested</v-col>
      </v-row>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4">AWRed</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="currentAWRed" disabled variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="suggestedAWRed" variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>
      <v-row>
        <v-col cols="4">AWBlue</v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="currentAWBlue" disabled variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
        <v-col cols="4">
          <v-text-field v-model="suggestedAWBlue" variant="outlined"></v-text-field>
        </v-col>
      </v-row>
    </v-card-text>
    <v-card-actions>
    <v-card-text>
      We have calculated better values for your AWRed and AWBlue : 
    </v-card-text>
      <v-btn color="primary" @click="sendSettings" variant="outlined">Improve</v-btn>
    </v-card-actions>
  </v-card>
</template>

<script>
export default {
  props: ['id'],
  data() {
    return {
      currentAWRed: '',
      currentAWBlue: '',
      suggestedAWRed: '',
      suggestedAWBlue: '',
    };
  },
  mounted() {
    this.setupSocketListeners();
  },
  methods: {
    setupSocketListeners() {
      if (this.$socket) {
        this.$socket.on('msg-input:' + this.id, (msg) => {
          if (msg.acq_wb_red !== undefined) {
            this.currentAWRed = msg.acq_wb_red;
          }
          if (msg.acq_wb_blue !== undefined) {
            this.currentAWBlue = msg.acq_wb_blue;
          }
          if (msg.acq_wb_hex !== undefined) {
            this.calculateSuggestedAW(msg.acq_wb_hex);
          }
        });
      }
    },
    hexToRgb(hex) {
      hex = hex.replace(/^#/, '');
      let bigint = parseInt(hex, 16);
      let r = (bigint >> 16) & 255;
      let g = (bigint >> 8) & 255;
      let b = bigint & 255;
      return { r, g, b };
    },
    calculateSuggestedAW(hexColor) {
      const { r, g, b } = this.hexToRgb(hexColor);
      let redAdjustment = (g - r) + parseInt(this.currentAWRed, 10);
      let blueAdjustment = (g - b) + parseInt(this.currentAWBlue, 10);
      this.suggestedAWRed = Math.max(0, redAdjustment);
      this.suggestedAWBlue = Math.max(0, blueAdjustment);
    },
    sendSettings() {
      const payload = {
        payload: {
          action: "settings",
          settings: {
            white_balance_gain: {
              blue: this.suggestedAWBlue,
              red: this.suggestedAWRed,
            },
          },
        },
        acq_wb_blue:this.suggestedAWBlue,
        acq_wb_red:this.suggestedAWRed,
        
        topic: "imager/image",
        
      };
      this.send(payload);
    },
  },
};
</script>
